STLStringUtility Class Reference

Some useful STL string functions. More...

#include <STLStringUtility.h>

Detailed Description

Some useful STL string functions.

const MC2String &  suffix = "",
char  dirSep = '/'
)  [static]
 

basename - strip directory and suffix from filenames

Parameters:
dirSep The directory seperator. Default '/'.
Returns:
name with any leading directory components removed. If specified, also remove a trailing SUFFIX.

uint32  lineWidth,
const MC2String  breakChars = MC2String(" \t-,&.:;+-=()"),
const MC2String  eolStr = MC2String("\n")
)  [static]
 

Breaks a line at blanks or if too wide word the word is broken after lineWidth chars.

Parameters:
line The line to break.
lineWidth The maximum line width.
breakChars The chars to break line at.
eolStr The char(s) that is end of line.
Returns:
A broken string :).

MC2String STLStringUtility::dirname (  const MC2String &  str,
char  dirSep = '/'
)  [static]
 

Strips non-directory part from filename.

The trailing '/' (dirSep) is not included in the result. If no directory part is found, . is returned.

Parameters:
dirSep The directory seperator. Default '/'.
Returns:
The non-directory part of the filename.

const MC2String &  str

Split a string by string.

str The string to separate.
Returns:
Array of strings.

MC2String STLStringUtility::fileExtension (  const MC2String &  str,
bool  tolower = false
)  [static]
 

Returns the dos-type file extension in lower case for a string (if tolower is not false).

Parameters:
str E.g. "filename.TXT"
tolower If true convert the extension to lower case.
Returns:
"txt" in the above case if tolower = true;

MC2String STLStringUtility::join (  const vector< MC2String > &  strings,
bool  removeEmptyStrings = false,
const char *  separator = " "
)  [static]
 

Joins the strings in a vector into one string.

For instance, if the vector contains "Hello" and "World!", join( strings ) returns "Hello World!".

Parameters:
strings The strings to join
removeEmptyStrings Should empty strings be ignored?
separator The separator with which to separate the strings

Replaces all occurances of a string with another one.

what the thing to replace in str
withThis the string thats going to be inserted

MC2String STLStringUtility::splitSeconds (  uint32  nbrSec  )  [static]
 

Calls StringUtility::splitSeconds but returns an MC2String.

bool STLStringUtility::strtod (  const MC2String &  str,
float64 &  val
)  [static]
 

Converts initial part of the string str to a float64 value.

Checks if the string is numerical. Calls strtod of the stdlib.h internally.

Parameters:
str The string to convert to a float64. May include leading white space.
val The float64 value we want.
Returns:
True if the string is numerical, false otherwise.

float64 STLStringUtility::strtod (  const MC2String &  str  )  [static]
 

Converts initial part of the string str to a float64 value.

Calls strtod of the stdlib.h internally.

Note that this function suffers from the same lack of error indication as atoi.

Parameters:
str The string to convert to a float64. May include leading white space.
Returns:
A float64 given by the first interpretable characters in the string str.

uint32 STLStringUtility::strtol (  const MC2String &  str,
int  base = 0
)  [static]
 

Calls strtol or strtoul of the stdlib.h internally.

Note that this function suffers from the same lack of error indication as atoi.

Parameters:
str The string to convert to a long. May include leading white space.
base The base to use, must be a value between 2 and 36 or the special value 0. When base 0 is used leading "0x" in the given string leads to the use of base 16, leading 0 leads to base 8. Otherwise base 10.
Returns:
A long given by the first interpretable characters in the string str. Unsigned for strtoul and signed for strtol.

uint64 STLStringUtility::strtoll (  const MC2String &  str,
int  base = 0
)  [static]
 

bool STLStringUtility::strtoul (  const MC2String &  str,
uint32 &  val,
int  base = 0
)  [static]
 

Works essentially like strtoul above but with error handling.

Parameters:
str The string to convert to an uint32. May include leading white space.
val The uint32 we want.
Returns:
True of the string is numerical.

uint32 STLStringUtility::strtoul (  const MC2String &  str,
int  base = 0
)  [static]
